history.content:
data 100 is the most prominent overlapping course that counts as an upperdiv for both majors. I took that when I was in your position waiting to declare. other than that, there are quite a few cs upper divs that count for both cs and data science majors such as:

COMPSCI 161. Computer Security (4 units)

COMPSCI 162. Operating Systems and Systems Programming (4 units)

COMPSCI 164. Programming Languages and Compilers (4 units)

COMPSCI 168. Introduction to the Internet: Architecture and Protocols (4 units)

COMPSCI 169. Software Engineering (4 units)

COMPSCI 170. Efficient Algorithms and Intractable Problems (4 units)

COMPSCI 186. Introduction to Database Systems (4 units)

COMPSCI 188. Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (4 units)

EECS 127. Optimization Models in Engineering (4 units)

EL ENG 120. Signals and Systems (4 units)

EL ENG 123. Digital Signal Processing (4 units)

EL ENG 129. Neural and Nonlinear Information Processing (3 units)

to name a few. there are probably more electives that could go either way. all info pulled from the major websites. good luck with declaring!

I'm not sure if I will be able to declare or not and this is my last semester for the 3 lower divs, so I was wondering what are some classes that overlap as both cs and data science so I can take them, no matter if I declare or not. Thanks
history.subject: uperdiv cs and data science classes that overlap
